io.jeo.data

Interface Dataset

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable, Disposable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    RasterDataset, TileDataset, VectorDataset
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CSVDataset, GDALDataset, GeobufDataset, GeoJSONDataset, GeoPkgDataset, GeoPkgTileSet, GeoPkgVector, MBTileSet, MemRasterDataset, MemTileDataset, MemVectorDataset, MongoDataset, OGRDataset, PostGISDataset

    public interface Dataset
extends Disposable
    A geospatial dataset.

    Base interface for dataset objects that contains the following properties:

    • bounds() - The spatial extent of data in the dataset
    • crs() - The projection / coordinate reference system of the data

    Author:
    Justin Deoliveira, OpenGeo
    See Also:
    VectorDataset, TileDataset

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Bounds bounds()
      The extent of the dataset in its native coordinate reference system.
      org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem crs()
      The native coordinate reference system of the layer, or null if unknown.
      Driver<?> driver()
      The driver used to open the dataset.
      Map<Key<?>,Object> driverOptions()
      The driver options for the dataset.
      String name()
      Name of the layer.

      • Methods inherited from interface io.jeo.data.Disposable

        close

        The driver used to open the dataset.

      • driverOptions

        Map<Key<?>,Object> driverOptions()
        The driver options for the dataset.

      • name

        String name()
        Name of the layer.

        The value used to look up a layer in a workspace.

      • crs

        org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem crs()
                                               throws IOException
        The native coordinate reference system of the layer, or null if unknown.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • bounds

        Bounds bounds()
              throws IOException
        The extent of the dataset in its native coordinate reference system.

        In the event the layer is empty this method should return an null envelope with Envelope.setToNull().

        Throws:
        IOException
